description:
Age groups

Explanatory notes for the following statistics:
12211 Microcensus

Definition:
The presentation of results by age group is based on the
year-of-age method. The data refer to the reporting date.
The year-of-age method is used to estimate the age of the
respondents whose birthday falls within the month of the
microcensus survey. The microcensus does not cover the date
of birth (only month of birth and year of birth). In the
year-of-age method, a frequency distribution of all
birthdays falling within the relevant survey month is used
to estimate the birthdays lying before or after a specific
reference day in that month. Accordingly, the relevant
persons have, or have not, completed the higher year of age
and are allocated to the higher age group or remain in the
current age group.
